wěidà great; mighty; large

Nányáng South Seas

traditional: 喜氣洋洋
xǐqìyángyáng jubilation (onomat.)
dàyáng oceans
dàxīyáng Atlantic
tàipíngyáng the Pacific Ocean

déyìyángyáng joyfully satisfied; to be immensely proud of oneself; proudly; an air of complacency
děiyìyángyáng elation

traditional: 東洋
Dōngyáng Eastern world
yángrén a foreigner; a westerner

traditional: 洋務
yángwù foreign affairs (in Qing times); foreign learning

traditional: 洋務運動
Yángwùyùndòng the self-strengthening movement, a pro-Western and modernizing party in late Qing
yángliú ocean current

traditional: 洋錢
yángqián foreign money; flat silver (former coinage); also written 銀元|银元
xīyáng the West; Europe; the Pacific (West from China)

traditional: 遠洋
yuǎnyáng distant seas; the open ocean (far from the coast)

traditional: 啟動
qǐdòng to start

traditional: 啟用
qǐyòng start using; enable (as in 'enable a feature')

traditional: 啟發
qǐfā to enlighten; to explain and arouse interest; to inspire

traditional: 啟示
qǐshì enlightenment; revelation; apocalypse

traditional: 啟程
qǐchéng set out on a journey
Méilín Merlin
méidú syphilis; pox
méihuā plum blossom
méiyǔ Asian rainy season; monsoon

traditional: 楊梅
yángméi myrica rubra

zhèngcè policy

traditional: 決策
juécè (make a) strategic decision
cèyuándì the source; the origin

yóngguǐzi foreign devil; term of abuse for Westerners

gòngchǎndǎngxuānyán Manifesto of the Communist Party; "Manifest der kommunistischen Partei" by Marx and Engels (1848)

traditional: 宣戰

xuānshì to vow; to pledge

traditional: 宣稱
xuānchēng assert; claim

traditional: 宣統
Xuāntǒng reign name (1909-1911) of the last Qing emperor Pu Yi 溥儀|溥仪
xuānyán declaration; manifesto

traditional: 宣講
xuānjiǎng to preach; to explain publicly

traditional: 宣讀
xuāndú to read out loud to an audience; a prepared speech (e.g. to a a party conference)
